editorialNotes.tagline: Don't let the zombies stop you

editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you get out alive?

editorialNotes.standard: The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defence series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The concept behind Kingdom Rush Frontiers is exceptionally simple: take the same great ideas, visual style, and fiendishly difficult tower defense that millions fell in love with in the original game and improve it by adding tons of incredible content. Frontiers packs new heroes, settings, towers, and tons of fresh enemies to fend off, making the frenzied action even harder to put down.

Badland is an eerie sidescroller in which you guide a nondescript creature through creepy and perilous environments. Thanks to simple controls and obvious objectives, the game is instantly accessible, but winding levels and unique power-ups make each stage an exercise in careful timing and hasty strategies. As the gameplay evolves and becomes increasingly bizarre, Badland remains incredibly fun.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: If they see you coming, its too late! Your mind is still your best weapon in the updated version of this sneaky 2006 action game.

Sure, there are skateboarding games that let you pull 900s from telephone wires, then land in a manual, collecting millions of points. But when you want realism and complexity, you want True Skate. For years, True Axis skateboarding simulator has been letting us ollie, grind and kickflip with our fingers. Competing with your friends, scouting gaps and completing missions is great fun, but the true reward is perfecting a line and nailing incredible tricks with just the right swipes.
Catchy music, incredible combo-filled combat, co-op play, and a blast of nostalgic spirit ensures this classic brawling series still packs a punch.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Still trying to get over it TBH

ios.subtitle: Its not a bug, its a feature

editorialNotes.tagline: Clean up Gotham one brick at a time

editorialNotes.standard: Youre a goat, free to run wild and cause mayhem in a virtual town. And trust us: that premise leads to tons of hilarious moments and stunts. Weve crashed parties, head-butted cars, bounced on trampolines, and done a million other goofy things in this outrageous sandbox game.

editorialNotes.tagline: Join the battle for Bikini Bottom

editorialNotes.standard: Randomly generated levels keep every punishing platforming challenge fresh as you dash to save your kid.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: Feed Hungry Fish And Grow Big

editorialNotes.short: Bend the rules and knock out opponents in this fun retro-style game.

editorialNotes.standard: Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The games vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TVwe feel like were meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.
Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Classics never go out of style

name: Willy's Wonderland

editorialNotes.standard: This acclaimed platformer motivates you to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.

ios.subtitle: Take command in World War II

editorialNotes.standard: Limbo is a gripping blend of stark, haunting landscapes, bizarre characters and unsettling sounds. With clever puzzle design, an intriguing narrative and an excellent touch-screen control system, its as rewarding to play as it is interesting to look at and listen to.
editorialNotes.short: Dark, haunting, beautiful. This'll stay with you long after it's over.

editorialNotes.standard: A well is usually one of the last things wed want to fall into, but this retro-style shooter has us jumping in again and again. Its a rush descending from rock to rock, blasting creepy creatures with your gunboots while nabbing crimson gems. Roguelike difficulty means youre in for a challenge, but superb controls and nifty upgrades (including a jetpack, a drone and laser sights) give you all the help youll need. And with randomly generated levels, each journey feels as fresh and exciting as the last.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: A wild sprint to the finish
